summary: TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 TOYOTA PRIUS.  WHILE DRIVING BETWEEN 45-50 MPH ON NORMAL ROAD CONDITIONS AT NIGHT, THE LOW BEAM HEADLIGHTS WERE ACTIVATED.  SUDDENLY, THE PASSENGER SIDE HEADLIGHT FAILED WITHOUT WARNING AND DECREASED VISIBILITY.  IN ADDITION, THE DRIVER'S SIDE HEADLIGHT WAS NONFUNCTIONAL.  THE FAILURES OCCUR SPORADICALLY.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE AUTHORIZED DEALER FOR DIAGNOSTIC TESTING, BUT THEY COULD NOT DUPLICATE THE FAILURE.  THE VEHICLE HAS NOT BEEN REPAIRED.  THE CONTACT WAS CONCERNED OF THE SAFETY RISK INVOLVED.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 35,000 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 64,000.     UPDATED 03-27-09 *BF  THE CONSUMER STATED BOTH HEADLIGHTS KEPT GOING OUT. HE HAD TO TURN THE SWITCH OFF THEN ON AGAIN. UPDATED 03/31/09. *JB
